alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 8:19PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 845 PM MDT... At 817 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles north of Chivington, or 15 miles southwest of Cheyenne Wells, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Torrential rainfall with this storm may lead to localized flooding. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Cheyenne County in east central Colorado. This includes Highway 385 near mile marker 136. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for east central Colorado.
